result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob T Donnelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $150+ costs = $783.75 plus $25 drug testing fees= $808.75. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive***.
The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob T Donnelly

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 9:06 AM 
Defendant Jacob T Donnelly in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews court record. 
Right to Counsel reviewed.

Mr. Donnelly indicates that he wishes to accept settlement offer.
recess: 9:08am--reconvene: 9:13am

Right to counsel is given; the Defendant waives this right; the Court accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself.

Atty Shock moves to amend charge to Misdemeanor Possession of THC, Repeater contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) and 939.62(1)(a)

Without objection, the Court grants this amendment-- ADA Shock is to submit Amended Complaint post hearing.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on amended charge; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $150+ costs = $783.75 plus $25 drug testing fees= $808.75. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges, consecutive***.

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess: 9:32am

Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed

[ae] case called 11:04 AM Defendant Jacob T Donnelly in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed

recess 11:09 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/22 at 11:00 am    (2) Preliminary Hearing on 5/6/22 at 9:00 am
